conclusion: Analyze the image to understand the process of an ideal gas undergoing changes in pressure and volume.
The image depicts a p-V diagram of an ideal gas undergoing a series of processes from A to B to C to D.
The process starts at point A with a temperature of 300 K and involves an isothermal expansion to point B.
The curve BC is a hyperbola, and the process from C to D is isothermal.
The process from A to B is isothermal, so the temperature remains constant at 300 K.
The curve BC represents a hyperbolic process where the gas does work, decreasing internal energy.
The process from C to D is isothermal, so the temperature at point D is the same as at point C.
Since internal energy depends on temperature alone, and it's the same at C and D, the temperature at D is 300 K.
The temperature of the gas in state D is the same as in state A.
Final answer: The temperature at state D is 300 K.
